title: The global stakes of Taiwan’s election
description: Voters across Taiwan head to the polls Saturday in an election that could reverberate around the world. As pressure tactics increase from Beijing, the island of 23 million faces existential questions about how to preserve its identity and fend off war.

title: What is genocide, the key accusation in the case against Israel at the ICJ?
description: The ICJ case hinges on the definition of genocide and whether the judges find that Israel’s actions in and plans for Gaza meet that bar under international law.

title: Italy’s Meloni under pressure to condemn fascist salutes at Rome event
description: Hundreds of people allegedly performed the salutes at an event attended by members of the far-right prime minister’s party.

title: South Africa presses genocide case against Israel at international court
description: Thursday’s landmark case thrust discussion of the Gaza war into a new international forum. Israel will presents its rebuttal on Friday.

title: Gazan prisoners describe abuse at secretive Israeli detention sites
description: The Washington Post spoke to several Palestinians who say they were arrested in Gaza and detained inside Israel under a system rights groups say is ripe for abuse.

title: Blinken’s optimism for postwar Gaza runs into Mideast skepticism
description: Arab leaders insisted that any post-war plan for Gaza include movement toward Palestinian statehood, not a popular option for the Israeli government.

title: There’s a toilet problem at Britain’s $64,000-a-year school for elites
description: Eton College in Windsor said classes would start remotely as flooded sewers “won’t cope with the arrival of nearly 1,350 boys.” Thames Water is looking into it.

title: Covid kills nearly 10,000 in a month as holidays fuel spread, WHO says
description: World Health Organization chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said intensive care admissions also surged in December: “This level of preventable death is not acceptable.”

title: This heiress wants to tax the rich. And she’s giving away $27 million.
description: Marlene Engelhorn, whose ancestor founded chemical giant BASF, plans to give away part of her inheritance. A citizens council will decide how to distribute it.

title: 4 ways China is trying to interfere in Taiwan’s presidential election
description: China is using an array of methods — from economic coercion to military “gray zone” tactics — to influence Taiwan’s presidential election and boost its preferred candidate.

title: Israel-Gaza war live updates: South Africa to present genocide case against Israel at ICJ
description: South Africa will ask the World Court to order a halt to Israel’s attacks in Gaza, which it described as “genocidal.” Israel has rejected those allegations.

title: A Ukrainian lioness concussed in a missile attack needs a new home
description: Yuna, the lioness, is among many large animals in need of evacuation from Ukraine because they are at grave risk from Russian bombardment but many zoos don’t have space.
